message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CL, cs.SOC, cs.IR, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of fake news detection from social media, which involves analyzing the content of news articles as well as the social network of users who share them. This suggests that the paper could belong to several arXiv CS sub-categories, including Social and Information Networks (cs.SI), Computation and Language (cs.CL), Social and Economic Networks (cs.SOC), Information Retrieval (cs.IR), and Machine Learning (cs.LG). Among these, cs.SI and cs.CL are the most likely categories, as they directly relate to the problem of modeling the social network and content of news articles, respectively. However, cs.SOC, cs.IR, and cs.LG are also relevant sub-categories, as they involve techniques for analyzing social networks, text data, and machine learning models, respectively.
